intro: Polycarpon polycarpoides subsp. catalaunicum, commonly known as the Catalaunic polycarp, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly pubescent surface. This subspecies is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. It is a perennial herb that produces seeds in small, dry fruits.
